title: As a Partner League Club Admin, I want to Approve a new request
custom_steps:
Wires:

Utility: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61157b0b4e63099b430a28ef|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61157b0b4e63099b430a28ef|smart-link] 

Modal: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/611d3dcf260c7b1848168bac|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/611d3dcf260c7b1848168bac|smart-link] 

AC:

* When a user with the Partner League Club Admin role is viewing the Requests utility *for their own club*, they will see an Approve button on any request in Accepted state
* When a user with the Partner League President role is viewing the Requests utility *for their own league*, they will see an Approve button on any request in Accepted state
* When a user with the PLP BOC Admin role is viewing the Requests utility *for any league*, they will see an Approve button on any request in Accepted state
* Clicking the Approve button will launch the provided modal, prompting the user to confirm their action
** There will be an Approve button and a Cancel button
** Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
** Clicking Approve will update the requests status to Approved, dismiss the modal, and display an Approved success message
* When the request reaches Approved state, appropriate Email notifications (covered in separate story) will be sent out
* When the request becomes Approved, the expiration date will be removed from the Request widget in both EBIS and the Portal.

title: As a Partner League Club Admin, I want to be notified when a new request is Accepted
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a Partner League request reaches Accepted state, the system will generate a notification email
* The email will be sent the any users with the Partner League Club Admin role for the team the player is playing on
* The email will read as follows:
** Subject: New Partner League Request
** Body:  A new Partner League request from the \[MJ Submitting Org] for \[Player Roster First, Last] has been accepted.  This request will expire in 48 hours.
Please log into the Partner League Portal to approve.

title: As a Partner League President, I want to be notified when a new request is submitted
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a Partner League request reaches submitted state, the system will generate a notification email
* The email will be sent the any users with the League President role for the league the player is playing in
* The email will also be sent to the BOC League President Role
* The email will read as follows:
** Subject: New Partner League Request
** Body:  The \[MJ Submitting Org] submitted a new Partner League Request on \[submission date of request] for \[Player Roster First, Last] of the \[Partner League Club Name].

Please log into the Partner League Portal to Accept.

title: As a Club User, I want to create a new Partner League Request
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_requests&g=1
 - https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=create_a_request&g=1

AC:
 - Admin users will see a "New Request" button in the footer of the Partner League Requests widget
 - Clicking the button will launch the New Request modal
 - There will be a Cancel button on the modal
  -- Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
 - There will be a Player search box
  -- The Player box will be an autocompleter that is populated with *all* players currently appearing on Partner League Team Rosters
 - Selecting a player from the autocompleter will activate the Submit Request button
 - Clicking "Submit Request" will:
  -- Submit the request
  -- Dismiss the modal
  -- Display a blue "Submitted" success popup
 - The new request will be displayed in both the Partner League Requests widget in ebis and the Requests dashboard in the Partner League Portal

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to view the Requests Dashboard in the Partner League Portal
custom_steps:
Wire:  https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61157b0b4e63099b430a28ef
Data Discovery: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2254798893/Partner+League+Portal+-+Requests+Widget

AC:
 - In the top Nav of the Partner League Portal, there will be a Requests link, as depicted
 - Clicking Requests will load the Requests dashboard
 - The dashboard will match the provided wire and data discovery
 - The icons in the left nav will continue serving as a filter for the data displayed on the page
  -- Clicking American Assoc will display American Assoc data, etc.
 - Club users will only see request data pertaining to their club
 - League Presidents will see all request data for their League, but no data for other Leagues
 - A BOC User would see all request data across leagues

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to attach a file to Player's Profile
custom_steps:
AC:
 - This covers attaching a file to profile

title: As an EBIS User, I want to View/Edit a Partner League Profile
custom_steps:
Wires:

* Roster widget:  [https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_requests&g=1|https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_requests&g=1]
* Profile: [https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_player_profile&g=1|https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_player_profile&g=1]

AC:

* Player's names will be displayed as hyperlinks in ebis
* Clicking the hyperlink will open the player's profile
* The profile will open in View mode and match the provided wire
** It will look like a professional player profile in ebis, but display the Partner League information in the header
* Users with the "PLP BOC Admin" role will see an edit button
** Clicking Edit will reload the profile in view mode
** The profile will function like a normal ebis profile with all the same rules and field validation and follow the same Save and Cancel flows

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to View a Player's Profile
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - Not Editable: https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61269d2d33e304a24d5d0c49

AC:
 - Clicking a player's name will open the player's profile
 - Users without the permission to edit the player's profile will see a the profile open as an ineditable form
  -- The user will not be able to make edits
 - There will be a 'Close' button
 - Clicking Close will return the user to their entry point without any prompting or modals

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to remove a player from a roster
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfb07ea37611091ba842
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bfeaa33e589cd2740617

AC:
 - When viewing a team's roster, users with the appropriate permissions will see a Trash Can icon next to each player's name, as depicted in the provided wire
 - Clicking the icon will launch the provided "Remove player from roster' modal
 - There will be a 'Remove Player' and 'Cancel' button on the modal
 - Clicking the 'Cancel' button will dismiss the modal and return the user to the team's roster
 - Clicking 'Remove Player' will remove the selected player from the roster, dismiss the modal, and return the user to the team's roster page
 - A green 'Removed' success message will also be displayed

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want the system to check if a new players exists in EBIS or is a non-active portal player
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112d6a6c892069ca752bd8c
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bfea522ffe9bd1baaf0a

AC:
 - When the user enters the 4 required matching fields and clicks the "Create New Player" button, the system will perform a match check to see if the player exists in EBIS or if they are an inactive Partner League player
 - If a player is found, the system will return the provided matching modal
 - There will be a 'Continue Creating New Player' and a 'Cancel' button
 - Clicking 'Cancel' will dismiss the modal and return the user to the New Player screen
 - Clicking "Continue...' will bring the user to a new player profile and allow them to continue creating the new player
 - There will also be an 'Add to Roster" button, as depicted
 - Clicking the 'Add to Roster' button will place the matching player profile on the appropriate team's roster, dismiss the modal, and bring the user to the team's roster page
 - The system will also display  a green success notification, as depicted

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want the system to check if a new player exists on any other Partner League roster
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112d6a6c892069ca752bd8c
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bfea522ffe9bd1baaf0a

AC:
 - When the user enters the 4 required matching fields and clicks the "Create New Player" button, the system will perform a match check to see if the player exists on Partner League Club Roster (in any league)
 - If a player is found, the system will return the provided matching modal
 - There will be a 'Continue Creating New Player' and a 'Cancel' button
 - Clicking 'Cancel' will dismiss the modal and return the user to the New Player screen
 - Clicking "Continue...' will bring the user to a new player profile and allow them to continue creating the new player

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to add a player to my roster
custom_steps:
Wire:
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfb07ea37611091ba842
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112d6a6c892069ca752bd8c

AC:
 - When viewing the Roster page, there will be a New Player button
 - There will be a New Player button in the top Nav
 - Clicking either will bring the user to the New Player page depicted in the wire
 - When the required fields are filled in, the Create New Player button will be come active
 - Team users may add new players for their own team
  -- Team users will not be able to change the team dropdown from their team
 - Presidents may add new players for any team in their league
  -- League presidents will only be able to choose teams in their league from the dopdown
 - Clicking Create New Player will load the new player profile page
  -- The new player profile will follow the layout from the wire
 - When all required fields are complete, the Save button will become active
 - Clicking Save will create the player profile and add the player to the roster
 - A new entry will be added to the TX History

NOTE: This story does not cover any matching

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to view a Team's Roster
custom_steps:
Wires:

* [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfb07ea37611091ba842|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfb07ea37611091ba842]
* [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfafeed29916c5542e2d|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfafeed29916c5542e2d]
* [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfafc3bd75117abd288a|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfafc3bd75117abd288a]
* [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfae146ab75a47879965|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfae146ab75a47879965]

Leagues/Divisions/Teams: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2165506053/Partner+Leagues+and+Teams|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2165506053/Partner+Leagues+and+Teams]

AC:

* On the Roster tab, there will be a roster table as depicted
** The table will match the layout in the wire
* In the top portion of the page, each team will have a hyperlink listing the number of players currently on the roster
* Clicking the hyperlink will load that team's roster in the roster table
* There will be a team dropdown above the roster table that will allow the user to select which roster is displayed
* All users may see all rosters
* User type/affiliation will determine which roster is displayed by default:
** a Club user will see their club's roster displayed by default
** a League president will see their league displayed by default and the 1st sequential team will be selected
* Note - See attached video for roster behavior at the smallest breakpoint

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to view the Transaction History tab
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bea4784a0a8a6cd24c5e|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bea4784a0a8a6cd24c5e]

Data Discovery: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2164490395/Transaction+History|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2164490395/Transaction+History]

AC:

* There will be History tab in the top nav, as depicted
* Clicking the tab will load the Transaction History dashboard
* The layout will match the provided wire and data discovery
* The History tab will be the landing page for all users when logging into the portal
* The left nav will feature the 4 League logos, which will act as filters of sorts
** Whichever League logo is selected will determine which data is displayed on the page
** This functionality will carry over throughout the portal
* The header filters will allow the user to control which data is displayed in the table
* Unchecking the â€˜rangeâ€™ checkbox will remove one of the date pickers and allow the user to search for a specific date
* Request Activity will follow the visibility restrictions laid out in the data discovery

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to log into the Portal
custom_steps:
Wires:  [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cf418357781675d11b16|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cf418357781675d11b16]

AC:

* When a user enters valid OKTA credentials and clicks the Login button, they will gain access to the portal
* If they do not enter valid credentials, the corresponding OKTA message will be displayed -(See Login-S for message styling)-
* Any other OKTA errors will be displayed on this screen
* Users will not need to two-factor authenticate to gain access to the PLP

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to visit the log in page
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cf418357781675d11b16|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cf418357781675d11b16]

AC:

* Visiting partnerleague.mlb.com will return the log in page for the Partner League Portal
* The layout will match the provided wire
* -There will be a Forgot Password link-
* -The link will follow the same OKTA reset password flow that ebis uses-
